author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: يا مَنْ وَجْهُكَ كَعْبَتِيْ وَجَمالُكَ حَرَمِيْ وَشَطْرُكَ مَطْلَبِيْ وَذِكْرُكَ رَجائِيْ وَحُبُّكَ مُؤنِسِيْ وَعِشْقُكَ مُوجِدِيْ وَذِكْرُكَ أَنِيسِيْ وَقُرْبُكَ أَمَلِي وَوَصْلُكَ غايَةُ رَجائِي وَمُنْتَهى مَطْلَبِيْ، أَسْئَلُكَ أَنْ لا تُخَيِّبَنِيْ عَمَّا قَدَّرْتهُ لِخِيْرَةِ عِبادِكَ، ثُمَّ ارْزُقْنِيْ خَيْرَ الدُّنْيا وَالآخِرَةِ وَإِنَّكَ
translation: O Thou Whose face is the object of my adoration, Whose beauty is my sanctuary, Whose habitation is my goal, Whose praise is my hope, Whose providence is my companion, Whose love is the cause of my being, Whose mention is my solace, Whose nearness is my desire, Whose presence is my dearest wish and highest aspiration, I entreat Thee not to withhold from me the things Thou didst ordain for the chosen ones among Thy servants. Supply me, then, with the good of this world and of the next.
